Checklist Item: Users can log in and create an incident with title, type, site, severity, date/time, description.
Users can see all incidents in a list with basic filters.
Users can open any incident and see full details.
Incident statuses include: open, under_investigation, closed.
Incident status can be updated (e.g. from open to under_investigation to closed).
Incident types are configurable by an admin (e.g. Injury, Near Miss, Property Damage).
Incidents are always linked to a site (or deliberately marked as having no site with a clear rule).
Admins can create inspection templates with name and description.
Inspection templates contain ordered checklist items with label and optional category.
Users can start a new inspection by choosing site, template, and date/time.
Inspection checklist is auto-generated from the selected template.
For each checklist item, users can record result (ok, not_ok, n/a) and an optional comment.
System automatically sets overall_result to fail if any item is not_ok, otherwise pass.
Inspections list shows template, site, performed-by, date, and overall result.
Users can click an inspection row to view full details and all responses.
Admin can create new sites (locations).
Admin can edit existing sites (name and code).
Sites are used consistently in incidents and inspections.
Incident types are seeded on install but can be extended by admin without breaking the system.
From an incident detail view, users can create one or more action items linked to that incident.
From an inspection detail view, users can create action items from failed/not_ok checklist items.
Action items have title, description, source (incident or inspection), assigned_to, due_date, status.
Action item statuses include: open, in_progress, done, overdue.
System automatically marks action items as overdue when due_date is past and status is not done.
Users have a 'My Actions' view listing action items assigned to them.
Admins/managers have an 'All Actions' view listing all action items.
Action lists can be filtered by status, site, due date.
Users can upload files to incidents (e.g. photos, documents).
Users can upload files to inspections (evidence of findings).
Optionally, users can attach files to action items.
Each attachment stores linked entity type and ID, file name, file type, file size, uploaded_by, uploaded_at.
Incident and inspection detail views show a list of attachments with download links.
System enforces max file size and allowed file types.
Passwords are hashed securely (e.g. bcrypt); no plain-text storage.
All sensitive APIs require JWT-based authentication.
User roles include admin, manager, worker.
Admin-only routes like site and template management are protected by role checks.
Workers can create incidents, view their own incidents, view their own actions, and see inspections read-only.
Managers can view and manage incidents, inspections, and actions for their organisation.
System records audit logs when incidents are created.
System records audit logs when incident status or severity changes.
System records audit logs when inspections are created.
System records audit logs when action items are created or their status changes.
Incident detail view includes an Activity Log showing who did what and when.
Inspection detail view includes an Activity Log showing who did what and when.
Audit log records are immutable and cannot be edited.
Dashboard shows total incident count.
Dashboard shows count of open incidents.
Dashboard shows count of incidents in the last 30 days.
Dashboard shows count of inspections in the last 30 days.
Dashboard shows count of failed inspections in the last 30 days.
Dashboard shows a bar chart of incidents by type.
Dashboard shows a line chart of incidents by severity over time (e.g. last 12 months).
Dashboard shows a table of recent incidents (5–10 items).
Dashboard shows a table of recent inspections (5–10 items).
Users can export filtered incidents list to CSV or Excel.
Users can export filtered inspections list to CSV or Excel.
Users can export actions list to CSV or Excel.
App has a clean, consistent layout with header and main content areas.
Navigation clearly separates Dashboard, Incidents, Inspections, Actions, Admin.
Tables have clear headings, are sortable where appropriate, and show helpful empty states.
Forms provide validation messages and reasonable defaults.
UI works well on desktop and tablet screen sizes.
System sends email notifications when a new incident is created.
System sends email notifications when an action item is assigned.
Notification recipients are configurable per organisation or application.
At least one chat integration exists (e.g. Teams or Slack webhook) for new incidents.
App provides a basic Help or Support link.
There is simple documentation or FAQ for key workflows.
There is a clear way for users to contact support (e.g. email address).
No hard-coded dummy data is visible in production.
Non-admin users must not see or click admin-only features (no broken buttons).
No 500 errors occur for normal user actions (create incident, run inspection, etc.).
No confusing generic labels (like 'Record 1') are used instead of clear EHS language.
Users are not locked in: data can be exported and is not trapped in the system.
